blogs.title: The Pothole Plague: Unmasking the Culprits
blogs.content: Potholes are the result of a combination of factors such as weather, traffic, and road maintenance. Heavy rain and freezing temperatures can weaken road surfaces, while constant traffic wears down the asphalt.
blogs.author: Ali Ibrahim

blogs.title: Keep a safe distance
blogs.content: Maintain a reasonable distance from the vehicle in front of you. This will give you ample time to spot and react to potholes.
blogs.author: Ali Ibrahim

blogs.title: Reporting and Repairing Potholes
blogs.content: Reduce your speed when driving over uneven or damaged road surfaces. This will minimize the impact on your vehicle.
blogs.author: Ali Ibrahim

blogs.title: Choose the Right Lane
blogs.content: In multi-lane roads, opt for the middle lanes where possible. The outer lanes are usually more susceptible to potholes.
blogs.author: Ali Ibrahim

blogs.title: Navigating the Bumpy Roads
blogs.content: Impact from potholes can knock your wheels out of alignment, resulting in uneven tire wear and decreased fuel efficiency.
blogs.author: Ali Ibrahim
